business.headline: Will gold hold above Rs 1.30 lakh? Here's what experts sayGold prices in India remained stable as traders waited for the outcome of the US Federal Reserve meeting, with attention on both international and local drivers amid market volatility.

Aequs IPO: Check latest subscription details, GMP and moreThe grey market premium for the Aequs IPO is currently around Rs 45.5. Based on this, the estimated listing price works out to approximately Rs 169.5, implying potential listing gains of about 36.69% over the upper end of the price band.

Having undisclosed foreign income? Why is CBDT urging taxpayers to review ITRsThe CBDT has launched the second NUDGE campaign, contacting taxpayers who have not disclosed foreign income or assets, and setting a deadline of December 31 for revising Income Tax Returns to avoid penalties.

Applying for Meesho IPO? Investors should be aware of these red flagsThe IPO will close on December 5 and the allotment will be finalised on December 8. Meesho is set to list on the BSE and NSE on December 10.

PwC India flags tax shortfall but says FY26 fiscal deficit still on trackWhen the government presented the FY26 Budget earlier this year, it expected gross tax revenue to touch Rs 42.7 lakh crore. PwC now believes the final number will be closer to Rs 40 lakh crore, signalling a shortfall of nearly Rs 2.7 lakh crore.

Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; HUL down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 110.14 points as it recovered to 85,216.95, while the NSE Nifty 50 added 41.15 points to 26,027.15 as of 9:39 am.

Meesho vs Aequs vs Vidya Wire: Which IPO offers the best value?Meesho IPO was subscribed 2.46 times on Day 1, with retail investors bidding 4.13 times their quota. Aequs saw even stronger retail interest at 12.16 times, pushing its overall subscription to 3.56 times. Vidya Wires, a smaller issue, was subscribed 3.16 times overall.
1,232 IndiGo flight cancelled in November, aviation regulator probesThe Directorate General of Civil Aviation sought reasons from the airline over the cancellations of flight and delays in time.

EPFO ends Aadhaar–UAN extension: Will employers now face stricter ECR rules?EPFO confirms there will be no further deadline extensions for Aadhaar seeding with UAN, affecting ECR filing from November 2025.
Sensex, Nifty close flat as falling rupee sparks concern on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 31.46 points to close at 85,106.81, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.20 points to end at 25,986.00.

Transferring money to family to save tax: Smart move or legal risk?On the surface, it looks like easy tax efficiency. But experts say that while transferring money within the family is legal, using it as a tax-saving tool is far more complicated and can even invite scrutiny if not handled correctly.

Is a Rs 1.5 lakh monthly salary in metro cities really enough? CA answersA high salary may create the impression of financial stability, but metro expenses tell a different story. A chartered accountant has explained how a Rs 1.5 lakh monthly income can shrink rapidly once daily costs and EMIs are taken into account.

Aequs IPO fully subscribed: Is it a buy or skip?Aequs IPO has seen full subscription within hours of opening, drawing considerable interest from retail investors. Experts discuss the company's prospects, valuation, and investor considerations.

Are gold and silver heading towards record highs this week?Gold and silver prices in India have climbed sharply as the rupee lost ground against the US dollar, with market observers attributing these patterns to global economic indicators and currency stress.
Will the EPS-95 minimum pension be raised from Rs 1,000 to Rs 7,500?As pensioner groups renew their demand for a hike, is the government finally considering raising the EPS-95 minimum pension?

If it was forged, why not tell us?: Man refutes insurer's fraud tag on sister's claimWhen a dangerous blood clot hospitalised Purvi Gupta, her family expected their insurer to stand by them. Instead, they recount months of bewildering paperwork, escalating confusion, and a sudden fraud tag they insist was never disclosed. This week's 'Claim Denied' story follows a family left stunned and fighting for answers.

USD vs INR: Why is Rupee falling constantlyA weaker rupee makes imports more expensive, increases inflation risks and raises costs for companies dependent on foreign goods, especially fuel and machinery.

December 15 ITR deadline: Do you need to pay the 3rd advance tax instalment?The deadline for the third advance tax instalment for FY26 is approaching. Here's what taxpayers need to know about who must pay, what counts as advance tax liability, and the consequences of missing this important date.

Meesho IPO retail portion fully subscribed. Check latest GMP, total subscriptionA fully subscribed retail book and a steady Rs 49 GMP have set strong early cues for Meesho's IPO, with eyes now on whether institutional demand will push valuations higher.

Rupee in freefall, slides past 90 against US dollar: What next?The key question now is whether the rupee stabilises or slides deeper. All eyes are on the RBI's policy signal, foreign flows, and any movement in the India–US trade talks.

entertainment.headline: Yami Gautam slams extortion-like culture, paid negativity ahead of Dhurandhar Yami Gautam criticised Bollywood's growing "extortion-like" hype and paid negativity culture in a detailed note. She defended husband Aditya Dhar's hard work on Dhurandhar and urged the industry to unite against toxic practices.

Bride asks SRK to say zubaan kesari at Delhi wedding, his witty reply goes viral A viral video from a recent wedding in Delhi captures Shah Rukh Khan navigating a playful request to repeat his iconic zubaan kesari advertisement line.

Rashmika cheers as Pushpa 2 sets sight on Japan release. Check date, details Director Sukumar's Pushpa 2: The Rule, starring Allu Arjun, Rashmika Mandanna and Fahadh Faasil, is preparing for a theatrical release in Japan. The film will hit Japanese theatres in January 2026.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 102: Tanya, Amaal, Malti call out Gaurav as fake, opportunist As the Bigg Boss 19 finale approaches, tensions spike during an Open Mic night where Tanya, Amaal, Malti and Farrhana accuse Gaurav of being "fake" and "opportunistic." Despite roast sessions and heated arguments, the episode ends on a calmer note with reconciliations and Farrhana's poem.

BTS' Jin: The Moon, the Music and the making of K-pop's anti-idol BTS' Jin has carved a unique space in K-pop, blending introspection with charm to become an anti-idol who values sincerity over spectacle. His music, from 'Awake' to 'Moon,' reflects a journey of self-discovery and genuine connection with fans, setting him apart in the era of overexposure.

Rajpal Yadav jokes with Premanand Maharaj, shares life lessons in viral video Comedian Rajpal Yadav met spiritual leader Premanand Maharaj in Vrindavan. In a video going viral, he is seen entertaining with his trademark humour, and reflecting on his outlook towards life and happiness.

The Boys Season 5 makers unveils scorched Earth poster ahead of final showdown The Boys Season 5 teased an all-out war between Butcher and Homelander with intense new "scorched earth" poster, as the final season heads into post-production. With major character losses, Gen V crossovers, and a showdown for control, the series gears up for a massive 2026 finale.

Ilaiyaraaja settles copyright row with Good Bad Ugly, Dude makers for Rs 50 lakh Producers of Dude and Good Bad Ugly paid Rs 50 lakh to composer Ilaiyaraaja after agreement over unauthorised use of five of his songs in their films.

Faking a personality: How Tanya Mittal cracked the code in Bigg Boss 19 Spiritual influencer Tanya Mittal has kept 'Bigg Boss 19' audiences captivated with her mysterious persona and extravagant claims. Ahead of the grand finale, let's have a look at how her journey raised questions but has been a notable one.

Raj Nidimoru's ex-wife Shhyamali says no to drama after his marriage to Samantha Shhyamali De broke her silence with a note three days after ex-husband Raj Nidimoru married Samantha at the Isha Yoga Center. She thanked well-wishers and firmly said she wasn't seeking drama or attention.

Bigg Boss 19: Why Farrhana Bhatt's journey became bigger than the game Farrhana Bhatt's journey on Bigg Boss 19 evolved from early clashes and misconceptions to a powerful story of resilience, identity, and self-assurance. Her relationships, challenges, and the support she earned made her one of the most compelling narratives of the season.

Iranian director Jafar Panahi jailed for a year as his film wins big at US awards Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi received a one-year prison sentence and travel ban in Iran for alleged propaganda, coinciding with his film's recognition at major international awards ceremonies.

Priyanshu Painyulli opens up on his limited role in Tere Ishk Mein: I'm still new Actor Priyanshu Painyulli discussed his brief role in 'Tere Ishk Mein' in an exclusive interview. He also spoke about his bond with Dhanush and the nostalgic nod to Raanjhanaa in the film. (Spoilers ahead!)

Angammal review: Geetha Kailasam's powerhouse performance in a tale of autonomyRelease Date:Wed Dec 03, 2025 Angammal movie review: Directed by Vipin Radhakrishnan, Angammal is a stimulating and evocative piece of art that chronicles the life of a matriarch who lives on her own terms. Geetha Kailasam, with an exceptional performance, brings the story to life.

Exclusive: Ajinkya Deo on why Yash's Raavan in Ramayana breaks the mould Actor Ajinkya Deo, in an interview with India Today, shared his experience working with Yash in Nitesh Tiwari's Ramayana. The film promises grand scale and a fresh retelling of the epic with a star-studded cast.

DiCaprio, Jennifer Lawrence to start shoot for Scorsese's What Happens At Night Martin Scorsese's What Happens At Night, starring Leonardo DiCaprio and Jennifer Lawrence, begins filming in early 2026 and adapts Peter Cameron's psychological, gothic novel. The film follows a couple's disorienting journey in a remote European town as reality blurs, deepening the emotional and supernatural tension.

Truly disturbed: Anoushka Shankar criticises Air India for breaking her sitar Internationally acclaimed musician Anoushka Shankar has raised concerns over Air India's handling of musical instruments after reporting significant damage to her sitar post-flight, sharing her disappointment with the airline's service.

My Secret Santa review: Alexandra-Ryan star in sweet, warm but formulaic filmRelease Date:Wed Dec 03, 2025 My Secret Santa tells the story of a single mother taking on a Santa job to pay for her daughter's dream school. The film blends warmth, romance, and festive cheer with familiar Bollywood-style twists.

Zeeshan Ayyub calls Raanjhanaa problematic as Tere Ishk Mein faces similar backlash Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub has called Raanjhanaa "problematic," saying the film promoted aggression in one-sided love and should not be defended. His remarks come as Tere Ishk Mein faces similar criticism and Raanjhanaa's AI-altered re-release sparks a dispute between Aanand L. Rai and Eros.

general news.headline: PM Modi not one to give in to pressure: Vladimir Putin to India TodayIn a major world exclusive, Russian President Vladimir Putin spoke to India Today Group's Anjana Om Kashyap and Geeta Mohan at the Kremlin ahead of his historic visit to India.

What's behind IndiGo flight cancellations, delays? Flight duty rules in focusIndiGo: Large-scale IndiGo flight cancellations and delays continued in Delhi, Mumbai, and Kolkata airports on Thursday, impacting lakhs of passengers. But what's behind the disruptions?

2 years, 4 drownings: The jealousy trail behind Haryana woman's killing spreeOver two years, Poonam allegedly killed four children, including her own son, targetting them out of jealousy of their beauty. Police have confirmed her highly methodical and psychopathic approach in all cases.

Smog in the air, fog in the brain: Delhi's tree-pruning madness peaks at AQI 400The tag on shops, "We have no branches anywhere", can't be an advertisement for trees in Delhi, which is battling an air emergency. There is no logic why government staffers with greased palms should be going about lopping entire branches of trees in the name of pruning with an AQI above 400. There's smog, and there's brain fog.

Raj Nidimoru's ex-wife Shhyamali says no to drama after his marriage to SamanthaShhyamali De broke her silence with a note three days after ex-husband Raj Nidimoru married Samantha at the Isha Yoga Center. She thanked well-wishers and firmly said she wasn't seeking drama or attention.

Trinamool suspends MLA over proposal to build Babri Masjid in BengalThe Trinamool Congress on Thursday suspended Murshidabad MLA Humayun Kabir, accusing him of attempting to "communalise" political issues with support from the BJP.

ICAR's servers get breached one after another. Whiff of a scam in data wipeout?Sensitive recruitment and research records from India's top agricultural research body, the ICAR, disappeared first from the server in New Delhi and then from the backup device in Hyderabad earlier this year. Defying data-security protocols and due procedures, ICAR's silence and delayed enquiry have only intensified suspicions of a deeper cover-up behind the twin server wipe-outs.

IndiGo cancellations, delays continue; regulator summons airline officialsThe Directorate General of Civil Aviation has called IndiGo officials for a meeting amid ongoing operational disruptions causing flight cancellations and delays.

The rise of the 'AQI Holiday': Why forests are becoming India's new luxury escapesWe used to pick weekend destinations based on mood; head to the hills for romance, beaches for fun, a hotel with a decent spa whenever we needed pampering. Today, however, our travel plans begin with a universal question: "How bad is the AQI there?"

2nd Test, Day 1 Live: Brook takes on Australia after Crawley wicketAUS vs ENG, Ashes 2025, 2nd Test Day 1 Live Score: Harry Brook has come on with attacking intent mind and he is taking the charge to Australia despite the fall of Zak Crawley. Joe Root is playing the tentative knock as the hosts chase for more wickets.

5,000 members hired, given suicide training: Masood Azhar on Jaish women wingThe formation of Jamaat-ul-Mominat, headed by Masood Azhar's sister Saeeda, is aimed at reinforcing the Pakistan-based terrorist group's presence and expanding its reach by recruiting women.

No degree? Zoho will still hire you, says CEO Sridhar VembuZoho's Sridhar Vembu has publicly stated that a college degree is not needed for employment at his company. In a recent exchange on social media, Vembu called on Indian parents and companies to pay attention to shifting attitudes toward higher education, referencing trends in the US and Zoho's own hiring practices.
I am a doctor and here's what caring for older patients has taught me about fallsA geriatrician shares her experience with older patients about healthy ageing - physically, mentally, and emotionally.

Techie dies by suicide, cites harassment by neighbours, civic staff in noteA software engineer in Bengaluru died by suicide at his under-construction building after alleged harassment by two relatives who demanded Rs 20 lakh. His mother's complaint alleges they involved BBMP staff to pressure him. Police registered an FIR against the accused.

India should work to get S-500 system: Patna-born Russian MLA on Putin's visitIndia-origin Russian MLA Abhay Singh said that New Delhi should seek the S-500 air-defence system from Moscow as President Vladimir Putin is scheduled to arrive for the India-Russia summit expected to focus on defence, energy and labour mobility.

Hubble's cosmic photos are getting ruined. You won't believe by whatA surge in satellites orbiting Earth is introducing unprecedented light pollution, now threatening the images captured by powerful space telescopes, including Hubble, according to a recent NASA-led study.

Employee asks Reddit if boss's harsh WhatsApp rant at 10 pm is acceptable tone"Is this tone okay from a boss? Would you reply or just absorb it," read the title of the post shared by the employee on Reddit's Indian Workplace account.

Live: Proceedings commence in Rajya Sabha, question hour underway in Lok SabhaParliament Winter Session Live Updates: The Opposition walked into Parliament on the third day of the Winter Session wearing gas masks, using the symbolism to flag Delhi's worsening air pollution. Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi pressed for Parliament to list the country's deteriorating air quality as part of its business and open a debate on it. Hours earlier, INDIA bloc floor leaders had met to map out their strategy after the Centre agreed to the Opposition's demand for a debate on the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral roll. 

The breakthrough came after Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla convened an all-party meeting in the wake of repeated washouts. With the deadlock eased, the Lok Sabha will now take up the SIR as part of a wider debate on electoral reforms next Tuesday, December 9. Both sides have also agreed to hold a discussion marking 150 years of "Vande Mataram". Meanwhile, Rajya Sabha floor leaders are expected to draw up the schedule for debating these two subjects, but the Upper House will wait for the Lok Sabha to finish its discussions before taking them up. Stay tuned with India Today for all Live Updates.

Mecca's Kaaba seen like a bright light in stunning picture from spaceUsing a high-resolution Nikon camera, astronaut Don Pettit, renowned for his artistic space photography during his fourth ISS mission, captured the scene from the station's cupola window.

How a freedom fighter became India's first woman CA: A remarkable life storyR Sivabhogam became India's first woman Chartered Accountant in 1933. Her achievement challenged gender norms and paved the way for women in finance across India.

Finisher who? Raipur loss highlights India's glaring ODI weaknessSouth Africa's record chase of 359 exposed India's inability to push harder with the bat in the death overs. Hundreds from Virat Kohli and Ruturaj Gaikwad went in vain with at least 20–30 runs left on the field in the first innings.

Pak to sell national carrier PIA for IMF loans, Munir's Fauji firm among biddersPakistan's sale of its flag carrier PIA is its first major privatisation in two decades. The divestment comes because of an IMF bailout condition. With four bidders, including military-led Fauji Fertiliser, the auction on December 23 is key for a debt-ridden economy and its crippled national carrier.

Dentist's chair, big rooms, masks on walls: Videos of Epstein's private islandDemocratic lawmakers have released new photos and videos from Jeffrey Epstein's private island. The release intensifies calls for transparency amid ongoing trafficking and abuse investigations.

Delhi rooting for AAP: Kejriwal mocks BJP for losing two seats in MCD bypollThe election also witnessed a counting controversy as AAP's top leadership claimed that the BJP suspiciously won the Ashok Vihar seat after recounting.

Kartik Aaryan does Salman Khan's towel dance, Kajra re at sister's haldi. WatchActor Kartik Aaryan joined family and friends in Gwalior to celebrate his sister Kritika Tiwari's pre-wedding festivities, dancing at her haldi ceremony. Several pictures and videos from the celebrations have emerged online.

Yami Gautam slams extortion-like culture, paid negativity ahead of DhurandharYami Gautam criticised Bollywood's growing "extortion-like" hype and paid negativity culture in a detailed note. She defended husband Aditya Dhar's hard work on Dhurandhar and urged the industry to unite against toxic practices.

sports.headline: Why Cameron Green's IPL 2026 bidding war can't cross Rs. 18 Crore mark Cameron Green is expected to live the millionaire dream during the IPL 2026 auction, with many teams interested in him. However, the all-rounder cannot be sold for more than Rs. 18 Crores.

Age does not matter till Rohit, Kohli continue performing with bat: Tim Southee IND vs SA: Tim Southee feels that age does not matter for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma till they keep contributing runs in ODI cricket. Southee believes that India should carry the greatest ODI player of all time to the ODI World Cup 2027.

Mumbai Indians acquire Oval Invincibles in the Hundred, new name revealed Reliance Industries, owners of the Mumbai Indians, and Surrey County Cricket Club have entered a partnership, officially announcing the renaming of the Oval Invincibles franchise to MI London in The Hundred.

Rohit Sharma's eyelash falls, Pant's has the most millennial reaction ever IND vs SA: Wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant and opener Rohit Sharma shared a hilarious moment in India and South Africa's 2nd ODI match in Raipur. The incident sparked massive nostalgia amongst the millennials.

Premier League: Arsenal grind out Brentford win, Chelsea suffer shock loss Arsenal reinforced their position at the top of the Premier League with a disciplined win against Brentford, extending their unbeaten run. Chelsea, meanwhile, suffered a home defeat to Leeds United, slipping further behind in the title race.

A Virat Kohli ton finally isn't enough: India's 7-year unbeaten ODI streak ends Virat Kohli's superb 102 in Raipur could not save India, who suffered their first ODI defeat with a Kohli century in nearly seven years. His stand with Ruturaj Gaikwad set up 358, but South Africa chased it down to level the series.

What Gautam Gambhir told Ruturaj Gaikwad after giving No.4 role? India batter reveals India batter Ruturaj Gaikwad revealed the message he got from Gautam Gambhir after being told to play the role of No.4 during the South Africa ODIs. Gaikwad hit his maiden ODI hundred during the match in Raipur.

2nd Test, Day 1 Live: Neser breaks through as Crawley falls AUS vs ENG, Ashes 2025, 2nd Test Day 1 Live Score: Zak Crawley's brilliant knock has come to an end as Michael Neser gets the big wicket of Australia after tea. Joe Root is still in the middle and is joined by Harry Brook.

Finisher who? Raipur loss highlights India's glaring ODI weakness South Africa's record chase of 359 exposed India's inability to push harder with the bat in the death overs. Hundreds from Virat Kohli and Ruturaj Gaikwad went in vain with at least 20–30 runs left on the field in the first innings.

A Virat Kohli ton finally isn't enough: India's 7-year unbeaten ODI streak ends Virat Kohli's superb 102 in Raipur could not save India, who suffered their first ODI defeat with a Kohli century in nearly seven years. His stand with Ruturaj Gaikwad set up 358, but South Africa chased it down to level the series.

What Gautam Gambhir told Ruturaj Gaikwad after giving No.4 role? India batter reveals India batter Ruturaj Gaikwad revealed the message he got from Gautam Gambhir after being told to play the role of No.4 during the South Africa ODIs. Gaikwad hit his maiden ODI hundred during the match in Raipur.

2nd Test, Day 1 Live: Neser breaks through as Crawley falls AUS vs ENG, Ashes 2025, 2nd Test Day 1 Live Score: Zak Crawley's brilliant knock has come to an end as Michael Neser gets the big wicket of Australia after tea. Joe Root is still in the middle and is joined by Harry Brook.

Finisher who? Raipur loss highlights India's glaring ODI weakness South Africa's record chase of 359 exposed India's inability to push harder with the bat in the death overs. Hundreds from Virat Kohli and Ruturaj Gaikwad went in vain with at least 20–30 runs left on the field in the first innings.

Leader and mentor: Virat Kohli's double role in Raipur earns praise from GavaskarVirat Kohli did more than score runs in the Raipur ODI. He steadied a nervous Ruturaj Gaikwad after a brutal first-ball bouncer from Marco Jansen, helping him settle before he struck his maiden ODI hundred. Sunil Gavaskar praised Kohli's leadership and mentorship during the key partnership.

Jadeja the culprit? KL Rahul admits late-overs slump as India fail to defend 359IND vs SA, 2nd ODI: South Africa's record chase exposed India's lack of a finishing kick and the impact of relentless dew, prompting KL Rahul to admit his side left crucial runs on the field in Raipur.

Virat Kohli, Ruturaj Gaikwad tons not enough as SA chase 359 in dewy RaipurIndia vs South Africa, 2nd ODI: South Africa scripted the joint-highest successful chase by a visiting team in ODIs in India when they gunned down 359 on a dewy evening. India finished second-best in Raipur despite hundreds from Virat Kohli and Ruturaj Gaikwad.

Sports Minister leads talks to end Indian football impasse, confronts AIFF on issuesSports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya met AIFF officials, club representatives and prospective bidders to address Indian football's financial and structural crisis. He questioned leadership lapses, heard stakeholder concerns and promised a plan to end the ongoing stalemate.

Smoke shisha, talk cricket: MS Dhoni's open-door CSK routine revealed by ex-teammateMichael Hussey lifts the lid on MS Dhoni's relaxed and welcoming team culture at CSK, sharing stories of open-room hangouts, shisha sessions and Dhoni's surprising lack of keeping practice.

Irritated by media attention, Stokes snaps at Aussie reporter over e-scooter rowAshes: A tense standoff unfolded between Ben Stokes and a reporter in Brisbane after the England captain and teammates were questioned about not wearing helmets while riding e-scooters.

Aiden Markram first visiting SA opener to hit hundred vs India in a decadeAiden Markram scored a superb 110 to become the first South African opener in ten years to make an ODI century in India. His dismissal marked a turning point as India regained control in a high-scoring match.

Virat Kohli's 53rd ODI century and roadmap to 2027 World CupIND vs SA: Virat Kohli scored his 53rd ODI hundred in Raipur on Wednesday. The former captain hit back-to-back hundreds against South Africa, raising the hopes of his place in the 2027 ODI World Cup squad.

Ashes 2025-26: All you need to know about the pink-ball Test in BrisbaneAustralia aim to extend their dominance in day-night Tests as England looks to rebound from a heavy Perth defeat. With pitch conditions, twilight swing, and late-week storms in play, the Gabba pink-ball clash promises a decisive early twist in the 2025 Ashes.

T20 specialist Mohit Sharma announces retirement from all formats of cricketMohit Sharma, 37, retired from all formats of cricket on December 3. The former Delhi Capitals and Chennai Super Kings bowler made an impact as a death bowler in T20 cricket.

Rinku Singh deserves a place: Fans slam batter's snub from IND vs SA T20I seriesIND vs SA: Rinku Singh's exclusion from India's T20I squad for the South Africa series has sparked widespread fan outrage. With the T20 World Cup 2026 looming, many believe his strike-rate and finishing skills made him indispensable — yet he remains overlooked.

Virat Kohli addicted to scoring centuries: Cricket world celebrates 53rd ODI 100IND vs SA: Virat Kohli's back-to-back centuries have reasserted his dominance in ODI cricket at the perfect moment. With a World Cup year approaching, the King looks firmly back in his most unstoppable rhythm.

Rohit Sharma unveils India's new jersey for 2026 T20 World CupRohit Sharma unveiled India's new jersey for the 2026 T20 World Cup during the mid-innings break of the second ODI against South Africa in Raipur on Wednesday.

Shubman Gill and Hardik Pandya return as India announce T20I squadIndia vs South Africa: The BCCI announced a 15-man squad for a five-match T20I series, which will be played from December 9 to 19. Shubman Gill returned as vice-captain, but his availability will be subject to fitness.

Queensland minister slams Ben Stokes & co for driving e-scooter without helmetsLocal authorities and officials in Queensland have called out England cricket stars Ben Stokes, Mark Wood and Jamie Smith after they were seen riding electric two-wheelers without helmets in Brisbane, despite local regulations mandating protective gear.

Ruturaj Gaikwad's maiden ODI hundred draws praise for Gautam Gambhir. Here's whyRuturaj Gaikwad's first ODI hundred becomes a validation of head coach Gautam Gambhir's selection strategy, with cricketing voices praising the clarity of roles that enabled the batter to excel in an unfamiliar position.

Watch: Ruturaj Gaikwad narrowly escapes being hit by Kohli's fierce straight hitRuturaj Gaikwad narrowly escaped injury from a powerful shot by Virat Kohli during their record partnership in the second ODI against South Africa. The duo added 195 runs for the third wicket to stabilise India's innings and set a new highest partnership record against South Africa.

Virat Kohli Hits 53rd ODI Century vs South Africa; Ruturaj Gaikwad Slams Maiden TonIn this Special Report, India Today's Consulting Editor (Sports) Nikhil Naaz reports on Virat Kohli's record-breaking 53rd ODI century against South Africa in Raipur. Kohli, scoring his 84th international hundred, built a match-winning partnership with Ruturaj Gaikwad, who registered his maiden ODI ton. Naaz highlights Kohli's 'unbelievable' consistency and addresses speculations about his Test return. Quoting Kohli, Naaz confirms the star batter's decision to stick to one format: 'I'm focusing on the ODI format, that's the only format that I continue to play.' The report analyzes how the duo rescued India from a precarious 60 for 2 to dominate the 2nd ODI.

Virat Kohli roars again, hits back-to-back hundreds vs South AfricaIndia vs South Africa: Star India batter Virat Kohli extended his 50-over purple patch characteristically, scoring his 53rd ODI hundred and his second in succession against South Africa at the Shaheed Veer Narayan Singh International Stadium in Raipur on Wednesday.

Ruturaj converts rare opportunity, smashes maiden ODI hundred in RaipurIndia vs South Africa: Ruturaj Gaikwad hit his maiden ODI hundred on Wednesday, bringing up the landmark in just 77 deliveries. The Chennai Super Kings captain stitched a 190-plus partnership with Virat Kohli in Raipur.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
